Message services
[Platform abstraction]


Defines

#define IPDR_MAX_ERROR_LENGTH   511
#define IPDR_NO_ERROR_ERROR_MESSAGE   "No error"

Typedefs

typedef IPDR_Status(* IPDR_GetLastErrorMessage_t )(IPDR_PlatformArg P, char *Msg)

Detailed Description

The message services are used to interpret error codes from the underlying operating system.

Define Documentation

#define IPDR_MAX_ERROR_LENGTH   511
 

The longest error message that GetLastErrorMessage can return.

#define IPDR_NO_ERROR_ERROR_MESSAGE   "No error"
 

Value returned by IPDR_GetLastErrorMessage_t if there was no error.

Typedef Documentation

typedef IPDR_Status(* IPDR_GetLastErrorMessage_t)(IPDR_PlatformArg P, char *Msg)
 

Retrieve the error message corresponding to the last error that occurred in the current thread/task during a platform abstraction layer call (for example, in case of Unix, this should correspond to the current errno). If there is no error (e.g., on Unix errno == 0), then this should set the string to the IPDR_NO_ERROR_ERROR_MESSAGE

Parameters:
P The context argument when calling platform function, as passed to IPDR_InitExporter().
Msg (output) A buffer of at least IPDR_MAX_ERROR_LENGTH bytes, which receives a null-terminated C-string of the error message.
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise.
